This is netorare, but it isn't cheating.

NTR is essentially a genre whose goal is to project discomfort on the audience's part, where the discomfort comes in the form of sexual jealousy. A "why couldn't you do this to/for me"-type verbal/emotional slap in the face. Sure, in lots of stories the heroine is a girlfriend in love with her boyfriend, but that's just ONE netorare scenario that artists commonly use. The heroine also doesn't have to be forcibly raped for a story to be NTR, although that is common in netorare stories.

Netorare doesn't require the heroine and MC to be an "official couple" in love. Typically the heroine only needs a close relationship with the MC, such as a love interest, girlfriend, mother, sister, etc. NTR is a genre and just because the story and relationships don't align into what you believe to be NTR doesn't make it not so.

Too be honest this wasn't that bad of an ending. Yes the guy liked her but it was his fault for not jumping on it in the first place. He had so many opportunities to be with her but always backed out in the end. Not saying that she wouldn't have been taken anyways but at least then he'd have the other guy to blame. This was all on him. She didn't know that our main character liked her and didn't feel anything for him aside from brotherly love. The other guy is a prick sure and will probably dump her for another girl when he get tired of her but even still it's not his fault. In the end, our protagonist understood what happened and decided to let it go and move on instead of getting revenge. He did the right thing in how he handled it if you think about it. So while this was a bittersweet ending, it wasn't a bad one.
